Nice City and Countryside Tours, Easter day, 20 April 2003

---A beautiful Russian Orthodox church. As it was Easter Sunday, the service was in session so we couldn't take pictures indoors.---
---The town of Grasse, city of perfume and birthplace of the painter Fragonard.---
---For centuries, Grasse was a regional capita.---l

---A 13th century Romanesque Cathedral in Grasse with us in the foreground.---
---Our guide for the day in front of a World War I memorial.---
---Grasse was originally a leather-tanner city, but embarked on perfume making when the fashion for pefumed gloves arrived from Italy in the early 17th century.---

---Old impressive wooden doors are typical on apartment buildings.---
---The upper entrance to Fragonard Perfume Factory in Grasse. Many of these towns are on such steep hills you enter on one street and come out on another street above the first one!---
---Guide explaining how the essense used to be extracted from flowers- each tray held flowers on materials that drew out the essense.---
